open_risks: Escalation/retaliation cycle: concrete tariff timetable (10% from Feb with potential escalation later) increases likelihood of European countermeasures, prolonging risk-off and complicating inflation expectations.
Adverse cross-asset regime: equities draw down while long-end yields rise, causing valuation compression (esp. Nasdaq) and tightening financial conditions.
Headline-gap / liquidity air-pocket risk around political statements and Davos-related soundbites; systematic flows may amplify whipsaws.
Gold whipsaw risk: safe-haven premium vulnerable to sudden d√©tente headlines; alternatively can extend if trade risk morphs into stagflation narrative.

Macro data reprice risk: core PCE and PMI could override tariffs narrative temporarily by moving real rates; upside inflation surprise would be particularly toxic for NQ and supportive for gold via uncertainty channel.
